title: Gold Looks Overdue for a Pullback
summary: PRECIOUS METALS 0116 GMT — The Supreme Court’s decision to block President Trump from removing Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook until January potentially eases concerns over the Fed’s independence and the prospect of another dovish appointment to the board, says Tony Sycamore, market analyst at IG Markets.

title: Dow Jones Futures: Stock Market Hits Highs, Tesla Deliveries Due; Nvidia Partner Breaks Out

title: Gold Holds Five-Day Rally on Fed Cut Bets, US Shutdown Concerns
summary: Bullion traded near $3,860 an ounce, about $35 below a peak set on Wednesday, with the suspension in federal operations threatening to create a blackout in crucial economic figures that the Fed needs to make rate decisions.  Traders have added to bets the Fed will cut rates twice more this year to support a weakening labor market.  The rally has been supported by central-bank buying and rising holdings in gold-backed exchange-traded funds, as the Federal Reserve resumed interest-rate cuts.

title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures trade flat as government shutdown drags on
summary: US stock futures wavered as Wall Street's confidence in the Federal Reserve instituting more rate cuts this year so far overshadowed a US government shutdown with no end in sight.

title: Wall Street closes higher as investors shrug off US shutdown
summary:
STORY: Wall Street's main stock indexes rose on Wednesday, with Dow eking out a marginal gain, the S&P 500 adding about a third of a percent and the Nasdaq climbing more than four-tenths of a percent.

Investors largely shrugged off the first day of a U.S. government shutdown, which could delay the release of Friday's key nonfarm payrolls report if Democrats and Republicans don't reach a deal on a funding bill by then.

Shana Orczyk Sissel is founder and CEO of Banríon Capital Management.

“I do think the lack of economic data of some of the larger economic data points that the Fed pays attention to could delay the Fed from cutting further. But we did get soft ADP (Automatic Data Processing employment report) numbers today, and that gives a little bit of direction and it supports the Fed's belief that the labor markets are softening. We know that inflation is ticking higher, but the PCE (Personal Consumption Expenditure), which is the indicator that the Fed pays attention to, wouldn't report until later in this month. So it's not necessarily impacted right this very second. I don't know that it (government shutdown) impacts much right now."

Healthcare stocks rallied for a second straight day, after Pfizer cut a deal with President Trump that grants the drug company tariff relief in exchange for lower prices on certain prescription drugs. 

Pfizer gained more than six-and-a-half percent, Thermo Fisher added nearly nine-and-a-half percent.

:: AES

Other notable stock moves included AES, which rallied more than sixteen-and-a-half percent after the Financial Times reported that BlackRock-owned Global Infrastructure Partners was nearing a $38-billion deal to acquire the utility group.

:: File

:: Lithium Americas

And U.S.-listed shares of Canada's Lithium Americas soared more than 23% after the U.S. Department of Energy said it has taken a 5% stake in the mining company and a separate 5% stake in the company's Thacker Pass joint venture with General Motors. Thacker Pass is set to be the largest lithium source in the Western Hemisphere.
